item.title: Very Overgrown Public Tree Overhanging Private Property and Causing Damage - Outside 7 & 9 St John's Road, 22nd August
item.description:
Very Overgrown Public Tree Overhanging Private Property and causing damage to private fencing and bin sheds. This tree hasn't been pruned in over 5 years. Please can this be prioritised to prevent further damage to private properties? Outside 7 & 9 St John's Road Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St John's Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: By the hopscotch markings at the junction, 22nd August
item.description:
Are the watering bags placed at the base of young trees supposed to have holes cut in them? witnessed a Conway worker slash a nick in one on Inverness Street by the hopscotch markings at the junction of Arlington Road. It seemed an odd thing to do.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Inverness Street, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement is more than 30mm, 22nd August
item.description:
Measured the paving slab. As been monitoring since last reported. This paving slab was replaced with tarmac. I thought this was a temporary repair, as the rest of the street had new paving slabs laid. Since being replaced the tarmac has sunk causing a trip hazard for the elderly and disabled residence and for those with a sight impairment. The tarmac breaks away everytime it's driven over. Can this please be repaired with a paving slab as per original..

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chessington Avenue, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep Void In The Carriageway, 22nd August
item.description:

item.title: Metal pipes around the lawn and the messy condition of the grass, 22nd August
item.description:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am a resident of 58 Eversleigh Road (N3 1JA) and I am writing on behalf of myself and several neighbours. The communal grass area in front of our homes is in very poor condition. The rusted and broken metal poles are unsafe and make the entrance look extremely neglected, and the grass is dry and full of weeds. As council taxpayers, we expect at least a basic standard of maintenance. We kindly request that the poles are removed, the grass is properly maintained, and flowers or plants are added to improve the appearance of our street. Photos of the current condition are attached for your reference. Thank you for your prompt attention. Yours faithfully, Fatemeh Mansouri & Mehdi Tarat 58 Eversleigh Road N3 1JA

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57;59, Grosvenor Road, West Finchley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
